column2: As the 25.26-mm sagittal slice corresponds to the medial part of the auditory temporal cortex, its activation suggests that electrode stimulation is concentrated on the region of the cochlear nucleus in which the neurons that transduce high frequencies are located. Ottaviani F, Di Girolamo S, Briglia G, De Rossi G, Di Giuda D, Di Nardo W (1997) Tonotopic organization of human auditory cortex analyzed by single photon emission tomography.
